todos.title: Keep Persona Narrow
todos.body: Your target list should be very specific, so your email can be very specific.  An example of a broad persona is CMOs at large companies.  An example of a specific personal is CEOs, Founders, at small technology companies who have recently launched a product and are looking to grow their market base.  1

todos.title: Test
todos.body: Test your message looking at open rate, response rate, sales generated. 4

todos.title: Metrics for testing emails
todos.body: Specific v vague, personalized v localized, questions, including numbers, humorous v straight-laced, ways of saying thanks, short v long,  text based v images, link placement, time of day, day of week, follow ups.

todos.title: Tailor Towards Your Persona
todos.body: Signal you are familiar with them and what they do.  Don’t be overly broad.  Include details that are relevant to the recipient, known pain, etc.  1

todos.title: Demonstrate Credibility
todos.body: Show them social proof. 4

todos.title: Contact
todos.body: Put all you content in your email signature. 4

todos.title: Presents
todos.body: Only bring people good stuff that they want. 2

todos.title: Never Assume
todos.body: Never assume that reader has seen previous emails, knows about you, understands industry standard acronyms/slang, knows how to use certain technologies, product, etc. 1

todos.title: Keep it Informal
todos.body: Make it feel so they can respond back on their iPhone with typos. 2

todos.title: Logical Assumptions
todos.body: Make assumptions based on their business, stage of growth, current industry challenges, etc. 3

todos.title: Subject Line
todos.body: Lure the reader in with a benefit or interesting question.  Must also be a little mysterious so they will want to click and learn more.  1

todos.title: Keep it Short
todos.body: Keep it two to four sentences at most. 4

todos.title: Research Your Prospect
todos.body: Include something personal.  3

todos.title: Use Referrals
todos.body: If possible. 4

todos.title: Put Yourself in Their Shoes
todos.body: How would you want to receive emails. I would want to know the information quick and not be hassled.  I would want to have keywords in the email that I could search for in the future when I needed to remember what the product was called.  I would want it to come from a person that I could respond to.  4

todos.title: Erase Recipients Concerns
todos.body: Give them social proof or a guarantee that dealing with you will be risk-free. 4

todos.title: Don’t’ be Self-Focused
todos.body: Focus on the Reader, Not Yourself.  Your goal is to solve your recipients pain points or learn more about them.  Always write in the second person.  1

todos.title: Get to Point
todos.body: Don’t waste their time talking about you.  Get to their pain point and offer help. 2

todos.title: Avoid Images
todos.body: Avoid images and keep signature short.  4

todos.title: Close with a Question
todos.body: Always require them to do something at the end of the email.  4

todos.title: Include PS
todos.body: A lot of people will read the p.s. before they read your closing question. 4
